cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 365 mi SE of Corpus Christi, TX
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating toward the northwest then slowing, on track to approach the middle Texas coast and linger near or just inland from Friday night through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just northeast of Corpus Christi to Matagorda Bay, TX

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (also within Storm Surge Warning zone)
weather_observation.watch_coast: No coastal watches in effect for the stretch including Freeport (nearest watch begins north of San Luis Pass).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Matagorda to High Island, TX; Storm Surge Warning from Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, TX.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward past Galveston, including Brazoria County where Port Freeport is located
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (72%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with a 24% chance of reaching 50-kt (58-mph) strength; gusts could be higher if Harvey strengthens more or tracks slightly farther northeast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NWS guidance calls for 5–7 ft inundation above ground level in the Sargent to San Luis Pass reach, which encompasses Port Freeport’s immediate coastline.
weather_observation.rainfall: 12–20 inches of total rainfall possible with locally higher amounts, producing life-threatening freshwater flooding over the upper Texas coast.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; prolonged periods of heavy rainfall could lead to port-area road closures and possible river flooding inland.
